Source Documentation¶

pyPheWAS – Root package¶

pyPheWAS.pyPhewas – pyPhewas file¶

Phewas object used to run different phenotype statistical anaylses.

This module is used to execute a variety of different analyses on large sets of patient phenotype data.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin – pyPhewaslin file¶

Python implemented code for running linear regressions on PheWAS inputs.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.calculate_odds_ratio(genotypes, phen_vector, covariates)[source]¶

Calculates the odds and p-value for using a linear regression.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.generate_feature_matrix(genotypes, phenotypes)[source]¶

Generate the feature matrix from the genotype and phenotype matrix.

The feature matrix is used to calculate the regressions. The feature matrix has a vector for each ID, each vector has the count of how many times that phewas code showed up for the given patient ID.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.get_bon_thresh(normalized, power)[source]¶

Calculate the bonferroni correction.

Divide the power by the sum of all finite values.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.get_codes()[source]¶

Gets the PheWAS codes from a local csv file and load it into a pandas dataframe.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.get_group_file(path, filename)[source]¶

Read all of the genotype data from an origin file and load it into a pandas dataframe.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.get_input(path, filename)[source]¶

Read all of the phenotype data from an origin file and load it into a pandas dataframe.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.get_x_label_positions(categories)[source]¶

Get the location to place each label on the x-axis.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.phewas(path, filename, groupfile, covariates, save='')[source]¶

This method will execute a linear regression for phewas.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.plot_data_points(x, y, thresh, save='')[source]¶

Plots x,y, and the threshold line.

An option can also be made to save the plot in a file of your choosing.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewaslin.run_phewas(fm, genotypes, covariates)[source]¶

Calculate an array of p-values.

Each p-value to the regression performed on each phewas code.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2 – pyPhewasv2 file¶

Python implemented code for running logarithmic regressions on PheWAS inputs.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.calculate_odds_ratio(genotypes, phen_vector, covariates)[source]¶

Calculates the odds and p-value for using a logarithmic regression.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.generate_feature_matrix(genotypes, phenotypes)[source]¶

Generate the feature matrix from the genotype and phenotype matrix.

The feature matrix is used to calculate the regressions. The feature matrix has a vector for each ID, each vector has the 0/1 count as for whether or not rhat phewas code showed up for the given patient ID.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.get_bon_thresh(normalized, power)[source]¶

Calculate the bonferroni correction.

Divide the power by the sum of all finite values.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.get_codes()[source]¶

Gets the PheWAS codes from a local csv file and load it into a pandas dataframe.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.get_group_file(path, filename)[source]¶

Read all of the genotype data from an origin file and load it into a pandas dataframe.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.get_input(path, filename)[source]¶

Read all of the phenotype data from an origin file and load it into a pandas dataframe.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.get_x_label_positions(categories)[source]¶

Get the location to place each label on the x-axis.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.phewas(path, filename, groupfile, covariates, save='', output='')[source]¶

This method will execute a linear regression for phewas.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.plot_data_points(x, y, thresh, save='')[source]¶

Plots x,y, and the threshold line.

An option can also be made to save the plot in a file of your choosing.

pyPheWAS.pyPhewasv2.run_phewas(fm, genotypes, covariates)[source]¶

Calculate an array of p-values.

Each p-value to the regression performed on each phewas code.
